results.title: Breast self-examination [revised version]
results.brief_description: An updated and revised version of the film “Breast self examination” (Title code 309812) encouraging women to adopt a simple method of breast self-examination as a regular health habit. Explains that if breast cancer was suspected earlier by women themselves, 80% of patients could be saved by surgery.

results.title: Breast cancer: the problem of early diagnosis (D)
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Audio Productions
results.brief_description: Emphasises importance of early, accurate diagnosis and effective treatment of disease. Many deaths can be prevented because (1) modern treatment cures most early breast cancers, and (2) early diagnosis is favoured by accessibility of this site to examination. Normal growth and development of breasts described; chemical pathology of breast cancer; techniques of breast examination. WARNING: CONTAINS GRAPHIC DEPICTIONS OF BREAST CANCER

results.title: Breakthrough to literacy
results.creator_credit: Robin Bates and London, Midland and Scottish Railway
results.brief_description: Explains the “Breakthrough” method of teaching children to read and write. Useful for parents and teachers and recommended for education discussion groups. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Breakthrough
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock, Senior Films and Victorian School for Deaf Children
results.brief_description: Education of deaf children in Victoria. At the Princess Elizabeth Kindergarten for the Deaf, very young children start the training which will fit them into a world of sound. Specially trained staff teach small groups by means of lip-reading, drawings and play-acting. Older children attend the St Kilda Road School, where, beside the ordinary curriculum, they learn domestic science, typing or a trade. Commentary by George Fairfax.

results.title: Breaking the delegation barrier
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Films
results.brief_description: How successful delegation sets free the energy and talents which are the real strength of any undertaking and the importance of overcoming the basic psychological obstacle: fear. At an organisational conference, three men competent and experienced in their own fields, but new to the responsibilities of supervision, are put in charge of newly expanded departments and are faced with a deadline resulting from a rush contract. As the months pass, each experiences and overcomes three of the most prevalent fears of delegation; fear of loss of job satisfaction, of mistakes and their repercussions and fear of loss of authority and prestige.

results.title: Breaking point
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: This film on safety shows how spinal injuries may be caused by incorrect posture during the lifting or pushing of heavy objects. Injuries due to car accidents are discussed and the use of seatbelts ito minimise accidents is demonstrated.

results.title: Breaking barriers
results.creator_credit: John Sexton Productions, New South Wales Film Corporation and New South Wales. Anti-Discrimination Board
results.brief_description: A look at your rights under the New South Wales Anti-Discrimination Act, 1977 where “equal opportunity” should be given to all and no discrimination should exist on the grounds of race, sex or marital status.

results.title: Breakdown
results.creator_credit: Ralph Strasser and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Break & enter
results.creator_credit: Amanda Brotchie, Melanie Coombs, Cinemedia Corporation and XYZ Entertainment
results.brief_description: A routine home invasion leads to a comedic exploration of gender and identity when a middle aged housewife swaps roles with the intruder who intended to rob her but was foiled by a frying pan. Cast includes Mark Peglar, Marion Heathfield and Robin Cummings with a music score by Mick Harvey.
